description: From Old French requerre (French: requérir), from Vulgar Latin *requærere, from Latin requīrō (“I require, seek, ask for”).

verbs.description: require (third-person singular simple present requires, present participle requiring, simple past and past participle required)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) To ask (someone) for something; to request. [14th–17th c.]
To demand, to insist upon (having); to call for authoritatively. [from 14th c.]
examples: "I am Miss Newbury," I announced, "and I require to be shown to my room immediately, if you please."

entries.meaning: Naturally to demand (something) as indispensable; to need, to call for as necessary. [from 15th c.]
examples: Chronic pain is occasionally a sign of a very serious problem, like brain tumors, and can require surgery.

entries.meaning: To demand of (someone) to do something. [from 18th c.]
examples: After Aug 3 all salesgirls will be required to wear only one style of skirt while on duty: the midi.
